title: For Sale:  Tennessee Mountain Rifle - aka Poor Boy
location: West of Berthoud, Fort Collins, Colorado
postcontent:
Tennessee Mountain Rifle – 50 caliber, black powder

I purchased a Dixie Gun Works - Tennessee Mountain Rifle kit long ago, put it together and used it hunting mule deer here in Colorado.  I just didn't want a Thompson Center Hawken rifle like everyone else.  I splintered the stock getting quickly out of a 4X4 hunting so I had 8” cut off the barrel and Williams adjustable sights installed by a gunsmith making it better for transport and use.  All the furniture and of course the barrel are steel which I rust browned the old fashioned way.  The stock is not stained, I believe I put a little linseed oil on it then waxed it with bowling alley wax trying in the beginning to keep it original until I altered it.  The barrel was 41 ½ inches, 15/16” across the flats and rifling is one turn in 56” making it round ball only.  It has double set triggers as you can see by the pix and percussion cap.  It was made in Japan by Miroku, a very old an respected manufacturer that makes guns for that little known company called Browning.  It shoots very well, accurately and is light in the field.  Kits today cost almost $500 and this is ready to shoot.  I have a bullet mold and lots of round ball to pass along to the first buyer of either of my 50's.

The P-3AT is a semi-automatic, locked breech pistol, chambered for the .380 Auto cartridge. It has been developed from our highly successful P-32 pistol with negligible increase in weight and size. The slidestop has been eliminated and the magazine capacity reduced to 6 rounds due to the larger cartridge. The firing mechanism is double action only. The magazine has a 6 round capacity. The KEL-TEC P-3AT is the lightest .380 Auto pistol ever made. Thanks to its locking dynamics and superior ergonometry, perceived recoil and practical accuracy are comparable to much larger guns. title: For Sale/Trade:  Yugoslavia Made AK-47 Under Fold Stock
postcontent:
Pretty much brand new. I fired a few rounds through it and didn't care for the trigger. I had a local gunsmith take a look at it. When I got her back I finished of the mag I started with (30 rounds) worked great. I cleanned it and it has set in my bedroom ever since. 
These are going to be banned really soon since what happened last Friday. Since what did happen last Friday I really don't care to own it myself but I don't want it going to anyone that it may be used in that way. I'm a hunter so I have no use at all for an AK. I've owned one now, I've fired it, now I'd rather have something I can use.

Anyone that knows anything about a AK-47 will tell you the Yugoslavia made AK is made a heck of a lot better than the Romanian made AK's. 

Rifle comes with one 30 round mag. I have more if needed. I also have a lot of ammo I'll trade for ammo I can use.

title: For Sale:  "Old" Ruger Vaquero .45 Colt - first month of production
postcontent:
I have listed for sale my Ruger Vacquero 5.5" Blued/Case Hardened finish pistol chambered in .45 Colt. Ruger has verified from the serial number that this pistol shipped from the factory in the first month of production of the Vaquero (April, 1993). This is NOT the New Vaquero. This pistol is the original Vaquero that is capable of safely firing the higher pressure "Ruger-only" loads found in the handload manuals. The New Model Vaquero has thinner cylinder walls and cannot accept these loads. What that means is that this Vaquero is capable of loads exceeding .44 magnum balistics.

Condition of this pistol is Very Good to Excellent. The bore is shiny. The pistol has slight wear at the muzzle and end of the ejector housing. The ejector housing also has slight scratches at the bottom, and scratches from the ejector rod cycling. Overall blued finish is 90+%. Slight turn marks on the cylinder. The case hardened finish is more difficult to rate, but appears 80-90+% ( I can't tell if there has been some fading, or if that is the way it came). Disclaimer, I am not an expert at rating firearms, so the condition could be slightly better or worse than I have stated.

There is no box or paperwork with this pistol. As well, the grips are not original, as it shipped from the factory with eagle rosewood grips.

I am firm on the price. I have done my research online as best I could and found pistols of this vintage and condition to go from $600-$700, the higher end are with box and no papers. I have this one set as low as I will take. Pistol will come with a box of Hornady Critical Defense.

title: For Sale:  Remington model 8
postcontent: Unfortunately I need to thin out my collection due to financial problems. Therefore I have decided to sell the most beautiful rifle in my collection. My 1908 Remington model 8 autoloading rifle chambered in .30 Remington also known as 30/30 rimless. John browning originally designed this rifle for deer hunters but it became popular with police and military use. Most notably the famous Texas ranger Frank Hamer carried a model 8 religiously and is credited with gunning down Bonnie and Clyde with his custom model that Remington made for him after learning about his affection for the gun. Many people see a resemblance in this browning designed rifle with one of his most famous, the B.A.R. However I believe it to be much more beautiful rifle. This is a rifle for the serious collector only. It is in exceptional condition with very few signs of wear. Please text me at REDACTED for pictures or call with questions. $450 is what I will take for it, and that's a steal as I see them go for up to $900 in this condition.

title: For Sale:  WW2 Polish Radom 9mm Nazi marked
postcontent:
The left side of the slide is marked "F.B. RADOM VIS Mod.35.Pat.Nr. 15567". Eagle/77 acceptance marks are stamped on the slide and frame, with an eagle/623 and eagle firing proof on the slide. Has the takedown catch and fitted with standard "FB" and "VIS" molded grips.

This is an capture piece between 1939-1940, with the stamped " X ", has a very low letter " P " - four digit serial number.


This is an GRADE 2 IN CLASSIFICATION, VERY RARE, and said to be some of the best 9mm pistols during the time period.



This still has the breakdown catch on the side, which some models are missing this feature.

The de-cocker works perfectly just like it should, fires perfectly.

This pistol is valued around 1000.00 - 1400.00 as it is rare, and an early piece, and also was captured, and re-issued piece during the war, does have a very low 4 digit serial number.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



This is a great 9mm pistol, the first model pistols in history with a decocker on it.



-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


This is a 1000.00 plus pistol, but it's not really what I like to own, or shoot.   


I'm selling this to buy a SCAR chambered in .22 caliber that someone has for sale.


I'm asking $ 650.00 or best offer, don't hesitate to make me an offer on this pistol.

title: For Sale:  1888 Vintage Hopkins & Allen .32 S&W Revolver in Working Condition
location: Anywhere between Vancouver and Kelso, Southwest Washington, Washington
postcontent:
21 or older, Washington resident, in-person sale or trade only.  $165 cash or possible trade (see below.)  I can meet you in Vancouver or Kelso.  Just email me for a time and place.

Positively dated to 1888, this is a Hopkins & Allen Double Action No. 6 .32 pocket revolver.  It uses .32 S&W ammo, which is easy to buy online.  I have tested this revolver with Magtech ammo, and it works just fine.  I'm including 25 rounds of ammo in the deal.  I know this revolver works.  But to cover my you-know-what, since it's an antique gun, I have to tell you that you should have this revolver thoroughly checked over by a certified gunsmith before you attempt to fire it.  Interestingly, because this revolver was manufactured before January 1, 1899 no FFL is required to ship or receive it through the mail.

$165 cash or I will consider swapping for a .22 rifle or a cheap automatic pistol like a Hi-Point.

Positively dated to 1888, this is a Hopkins & Allen Double Action No. 6 .32 pocket revolver.  It uses .32 S&W ammo, which is easy to buy online. Interestingly, because this revolver was manufactured before January 1, 1899 no FFL is required to ship or receive it through the mail.

$165 cash or I will consider swapping for a .22 rifle or a cheap automatic pistol like a Hi-Point.

title: For Sale:  Ruger SR1911
postcontent:
Up for sale is my Ruger SR1911. This pistol is in fantastic condition and has had somewhere around 300 rounds fired through it. The gun comes with the following items:

Original box, papers, shell casing
1 Ruger 8rd and 1 7 rd magazine
1 Ruger soft case
1 Blackhawk OWB holster (polymer, not a button-release type)

This is a fullsize 1911 with a 5" barrel. It uses Novak 3-dot sights and the finish is a very tough dull stainless steel grey. Unlike some stainless 1911's where the sides are polished, the finish is even over the entire surface of the gun. The trigger is adjustable for overtravel and I'd guess weighs in around 4lbs. These are extremely hard to find guns because of the features they include at the low price point. It has been great for me, but I've found myself wanting a Sig 4.2" scorpion instead.

Price is firm, please do not ask what I'll take. I paid $760 for the pistol and it was the only one I've ever actually seen for sale. Plus you're getting an unused holster as well. A fair deal for an excellent gun.

title: For Sale:  Colt Army Special 38, 6 inch barrel
postcontent:
This gun is clean and oiled.  I have not personally shot it, though.  It may need professional service because it does not index properly on one chamber of the magazine, due to wear on the magazine cylinder and/or indexing point (not sure about the technical name for the part).  The finish is not bad, but has wear.  There is a small nick over the trigger (left side) and minor pitting on the barrel (left side).  The bore looks very clean to me, and I have stored the gun in a case, always wiping it well after handling.  This gun also has an aftermarket right-handed grip.  It is a comfortable grip.
The last patent date stamped is July 4, (19)05.  It fires the .38 Long Colt round which are available through specialty ammunition suppliers on the web.  It should not be used with standard .38 Special rounds since they are higher power and may damage the pistol.
This is all I know about the model.  If you have any other questions, please contact me via email at REDACTED
Thanks!
Randy

title: For Sale:  Stripped AR-15 receivers.
postcontent:
Up for sale are Superior Arms brand stripped AR-15 lowers.  They're all mil-spec, never assembled lowers still in their bubble wrap.  Since they've never been assembled they can be made into either a handgun or a rifle.  

A nice feature of Superior Arms lowers that other manufacturers don't have is that they have a set-screw built in that can be used to tune the over-travel for the trigger.  

$150 FTF within 25 miles of Raeford (zip code 28376).  Must be 18+.  No purchase permit is required for a stripped lower.  No trades.  Any emails offering trades or low ball offers will not be replied to.

postcontent:
DAN WESSON 

Model: ECO 

Caliber: .45ACP

Add 4.35% for tax and 3% for credit card

Additional Description: Presenting the ECO, a true single stack officer size 1911 weighing in at only 25 oz. For years the officer 1911 has been criticized for reliability. We have taken care of that by using some of the latest technology as well as our background in doing what others say can’t be done. This gun has all the latest and greatest we have to offer. The ECO wears tritium night sights with our tactical ledge sight on the rear of our lightweight 3.5” slide. The barrel is a flush-cut ramped bull barrel with target crown rather than the traditional barrel and barrel bushing. This makes the gun slightly more compact and easier to disassemble. The recoil system is quite unique for this style of 1911 as we use a solid, one piece guide rod and a flat recoil spring that is rated for 15,000 rounds in .45 ACP. That is 15,000 rounds! Not 500 rounds like most 1911 dual recoil systems are rated for. This is unheard of in a production 1911! This recoil system also gives the benefit of a smooth slide for easier operation and less felt recoil. Trigger pull, like all of our 1911s, is short and crisp at around 4 lbs. This helps achieve the accuracy you’ve come to expect from a Dan Wesson.  The frame is anodized aluminum and features an undercut trigger guard and 25 LPI checkering. The mainspring housing is also aluminum with 25 LPI checkering and a rounded bottom corner for concealability and shooting comfort. These features coupled with the Ed Brown high ride grip safety and our new slim line DW carry G10 grips really help you hold onto the gun for faster follow-up shots and recoil control. Just like our Guardian, the ECO slide and small parts are treated with our Duty finish and available in both 9mm and .45 ACP. Stopping power is not a concern. If you’re looking for a compact, lightweight and reliable 1911 that beats the competition, look no further than our ECO. We are confident you won’t be disappointed. 

Dan Wesson

title: For Sale:  VERY RARE Colt Camp Perry Pistol
postcontent: VERY RARE Colt Camp Perry Pistol. Stock # MSH240411SP. Serial # 13xx. One of HUNDREDS of Collectible, Antique, Military, Sporting and Tactical Firearms for,this is a magnificent find for the Serious Colt Collector, a very rare Colt Camp Perry Pistol. Made for the top-level target matches held at Camp Perry, Colt only produced 2500 of these pistols between the years 1920-1941. Chambered for .22LR, the pistol is built on a Colt Officers Model Match frame, but it is a single shot pistol, the entire “cylinder” swings out for loading. The pistol has a 10 ” barrel with an adjustable rear sight, and the front sight is adjustable as well. As attractive as it is rare, the pistol is finished in Colt’s finest polished Commercial blue, and it has factory wooden checkered grips with silver-colored Colt Medallions. The pistol has a few very light service marks on the receiver and there is a very minute area of freckling on the right side of the receiver. There is also a tiny, but noticeable ding on the butt of the grips, this notwithstanding, these are very minor and overall condition of this beautiful pistol is 95%. The pistol has a shiny bore with strong rifling, and trigger pull is very smooth. This is a Museum-Grade Colt that will be a centerpiece of a fine collection. We do not have the box or any accessories for this gun. Please do not send an email regarding this item unless you have a sincere interest in purchasing it, rude and/or inappropriate comments will be ignored, please do not waste your time, and please don’t waste your time trying to impress us with your vast firearms knowledge, especially if you have no interest in purchasing the gun, thank you! Please call or email us with any questions BEFORE bidding on an item, your bid is a LEGAL CONTRACT TO PURCHASE THE ITEM

postcontent:
Last one...

Palmetto State Armory (PSA) 16" M4 Premium Carbine.  Here are the specs from the PSA website:

"Finally a complete rifle ready to go for one low price.  Our M4 Carbine starts with one of our Premium chrome-lined Mil-spec steel barrels in the versatile M4 profile, mated to our forged aluminum upper, and finished off with a standard carbine hand guard, Pinned f-marked front sight post and A2 Flash hider.  The forged lower is built with our 6 position Mil-spec size buffer tube and stock, Standard PSA lower parts kit with A2 pistol grip and aluminum trigger guard.  

Barrel:  16" chrome-lined mil-spec chrome moly vanadium barrel, chambered in 5.56 NATO, with a 1/7 twist, M4 barrel extension, and a carbine gas system.   M4 style profile is phosphate coated to mil-specs, and is High Pressure tested, and Magnetic Particle inspected, to ensure quality and dependability.   Barrel is finished off with a standard carbine hand guard, pinned f-marked front sight post, and A2 flash hider.

Upper: Forged 7075-T6 A3 AR upper is made to MIL-SPECS and hard coat anodized black for durability. Featuring machined T marks, and a mil-spec finish. These uppers are made for us right here in the USA by a mil-spec manufacturer, and are marked with the Palmetto State Armory logo on the left side, up front, just below the rail.

Bolt: Bolt is made of Mil-spec Carpenter 158 steel, Shot peened, and MPI. Gas key is secured with grade 8 fasteners and staked per mil-spec. Bolt carrier is parkerized outside, chrome lined inside.

Lower:  These forged lowers are quality made using 7075-T6 aluminum and are marked "MULTI" for caliber.  Finish is Black Hardcoat Anodize per MIL-8625 Type 3 class 2.  Mil-spec sized buffer tube is forged of 7075 aluminum, has 6 adjustment positions, is finished with an M4 stock and has a staked castle nut.  Standard carbine buffer is Black anodized and has the PSA logo on the face.  The standard PSA combat trigger has a smooth pull and clean break."

No rear sight or magazine included.  Price is FIRM.  These high quality carbines have been sold out at PSA for quite some time and last listed for $719.99 when they were instock.
